docs.snippet: For 50 years, residents have acted out the story of their lives, in a kind of collective self-analysis. This year, they pondered whether their village can survive.

docs.snippet: The case of a rights activist from Taiwan awaiting sentencing in China for subversion is emblematic of a wider, global campaign, critics say.

docs.snippet: The formation of new companies has failed to bounce back since the recession, and economists say the trend may be holding back wages and productivity.

docs.snippet: Why is such a sophisticated, spicy cuisine often rendered bland and cloying? A former Bangkok correspondent finds answers and good news in California.
